data: Ensure that the consent form for ECT is complete.
Ensure Anesthesia has been consulted before ordering ECT, as required
Note: this is a multiphase powerplan. Any changes made to one session must be duplicated for other sessions
Ensure Anesthesia has been consulted before ordering ECT, as required
Ensure that symptom assessment scales are completed when ECT is ordered and after every 6 treatments
Schedule once a week, 15 treatments total
Schedule two times a week, 15 treatments total
Schedule three times a week, 15 treatments total
By default benzodiazepines, lithium and anticonvulsants will be held 12 hours prior to ECT, please modify hold medication(s) order as necessary
Constant Order, Clinical event: Electroconvulsive Therapy, Medication(s) to be held: benzodiazepines, lithium and anticonvulsants, Instructions: hold 12 hours before ECT treatment
20 mg, PO, pre-procedure, PRN gastroparesis, drug form: tab
20 mg, PO, pre-procedure, PRN gastroparesis, drug form: tab
40 mg, PO, pre-procedure, PRN gastroparesis, drug form: tab
975 mg, PO, pre-procedure, PRN pain, drug form: tab [Less Than 60 kg]
1,300 mg, PO, pre-procedure, PRN pain, drug form: tab [Greater Than or Equal To 60 kg]
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, PO, pre-procedure, PRN pain, drug form: tab
400 mg, PO, pre-procedure, PRN pain, drug form: tab
Lab results must be obtained within 30 days prior to first treatment
Routine, Reason: Other (please specify), ECT treatment evaluation
Arrange to have transport/security accompany patient to ECT treatment as required

For AM ECT, NPO after midnight on nights before morning ECT treatment. For PM ECT, light breakfast (no dairy, fat or citrus juice) at 0700h and NPO thereafter, may have up to 500 ml (two glasses) clear fluids prior to 1000h to prevent dehydration
Discontinue Session 1 Pre-Procedure phase of MH Electroconvulsive Therapy (Multiphase) PowerPlan
Arrange to have transport/security accompany patient from ECT treatment as required
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, PO, q4h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab
dose range: 200 to 400 mg, PO, q4h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab
dose range: 200 to 400 mg, PO, q6h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, once, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, once, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
4 mg, IV, q8h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
